ygData.subject: Re: Sad Encounter
ygData.msgSnippet: Wow.... That s surprising. I m merely a level 5 bard, who has just learned Selo and how to play the drums. I know that it makes a change to the effect. (As
ygData.messageBody:
Wow.... That's surprising. I'm merely a level 5 bard, who has just learned
Selo and how to play the drums. I know that it makes a change to the effect.
(As well as chant of battle if I remember...) I have learned to greatly
appreciate Selo and my little hand drum, as I used it to run from a pair of
orc raiders that jumped me last night. It seems that the drum is not
necessary to run from mummies though (hehe...) I ran and ran and ran to the
guard. I stopped, turned around, and could just barely see the mummy heading
my way. Needless to say, the mummy did not get me. Sadly, though, Selo was
not enough speed to run from a Shadow Wolf. Which poses a question...As you
get better at Percussion, do you get faster? Does the same apply to singing?


----- Original Message -----
From: A.Rubman <Naturdoc@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, June 04, 1999 13:36
Subject: [eqbards] Sad Encounter


> From: "A.Rubman" <Naturdoc@...>
>
> I'm a level 12 Bard, and I'm quite happy. I know what my songs do, have
> 1 piece of banded, just learnt bellows and have 12 plat saved in the
> bank. I think I'm doing ok. Last night I died in freeport and was in
> faydark asking if any bard could spare a drum for me to use. A level 18
> bard, asked me what I used the drum for...I was a bit confused, but
> thinking this was some test, I responded to run faster with selo's. She
> then proceeded to argue with me that the drum did nothing to help you
> and that Selo's was a singing song. After 5 minutes of that she tried
> it, and said "oh wow, you're right". I'm just curious, have other people
> met bards like this? I thought from personal experience and reading this
> list that we have some of the most inteligent people, but now I'm
> begining to wonder.
>
> -Luini from Innoruk-
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> How has ONElist changed your life?
> Share your story with us at http://www.onelist.com
